rev.comment: added photo of murder trial defendants
rev.diff:
Line 25: Line 25:
==Murder Trial==
==Murder Trial==
  +
[[Image:Haywood_moyer_pettibone.jpg|thumb|left
  +
| 1907 photo of defendants [[Charles Moyer]], Bill Haywood, and [[George Pettibone]]]]
On [[December 30]], 1905, [[Frank Steunenberg]] was killed by an explosion in his [[Caldwell, Idaho]] home. The former governor of [[Idaho]] had clashed with the WFM in previous strikes, and after the 64-page confession of suspected bomber [[Harry Orchard]], famed [[Pinkerton National Detective Agency|Pinkerton]] detective [[James McParland]] was sent to arrest WFM leaders Haywood, [[Charles Moyer]], and [[George Pettibone]].<ref name=linder /> On [[February 17]], 1906, McParland secretly arrested Haywood, Moyer, and Pettibone in [[Denver, Colorado]]. In the morning, they were extradited to Idaho for trial.
On [[December 30]], 1905, [[Frank Steunenberg]] was killed by an explosion in his [[Caldwell, Idaho]] home. The former governor of [[Idaho]] had clashed with the WFM in previous strikes, and after the 64-page confession of suspected bomber [[Harry Orchard]], famed [[Pinkerton National Detective Agency|Pinkerton]] detective [[James McParland]] was sent to arrest WFM leaders Haywood, [[Charles Moyer]], and [[George Pettibone]].<ref name=linder /> On [[February 17]], 1906, McParland secretly arrested Haywood, Moyer, and Pettibone in [[Denver, Colorado]]. In the morning, they were extradited to Idaho for trial.
